location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The file is formed by one letter with earlier enclosures, arranged in chronological order.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the back cover with 23; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains a copy of a letter sent by the British Resident in the Persian Gulf to the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, regarding the date trade in Muscat. The letter encloses copies of letters forwarded by the Political Agent at Muscat on the cultivation of dates in the Persian Gulf, including a section of the report written by Mr Dawson of Basra 'on the Fauna, Flora and Geology of the parts of the Batinah visited by him in 1927' (folios 12-22).

name.namePart: Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs
